title: Is Adventures of Huckleberry Finn historical fiction? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is ‘historical fiction’ in this much, that the setting, the attitudes and behaviours of the protagonists reflect in truth some of the realities of the American South at the time Mark Twain was writing. But it is not ‘historical fiction’ in the same way that (say) Hilary Mantel’s enormous trilogy about Thomas’ Cromwell’s life and career is—written in a far-distant century about what is already a bygone age. LGHH
